intro: Silaum saxatilis, commonly known as rock pepper or mountain pepper, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Silaum saxatilis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
